content:
@larsdesigns If I get a chance (and can figure it out), do you mind if I have a go at https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/702 ?

Sanitize website backup changes 路 Issue #702 路 backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
I'd like to request a few changes to the backups hosted on the Sanitize website please: backdropcmsorg has 3 database dumps, and also a 'latest' dump whose URL is constant. I'd like...

@BWPanda This is the repository: https://github.com/serundeputy/sql-dump-sanitize

serundeputy/sql-dump-sanitize
The purpose of this script is to backup and optionally --sanitize the database of your Backdrop CMS website. - serundeputy/sql-dump-sanitize

Hmm, I thought I saw it was using https://github.com/larsdesigns/sql-dump-sanitize instead...

larsdesigns/sql-dump-sanitize
The purpose of this script is to backup and optionally --sanitize the database of your Backdrop CMS website. - larsdesigns/sql-dump-sanitize
But then I get confused with remote and origin...
Well, that was my fork but it is @Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) 's project.
What's the reason for sanitize.backdropcms.org having a username/password to access it? Since the DB is sanitized, do we need to restrict access?

@BWPanda anyone with a copy of the db will be able to set up a local version of b.org, which will allow them to have a look at how the site is configured (including any security/privacy/sensitive settings) ...I think that access to it is on a per-case/request case - not to be open for public consumption.
...we disclose the shield credentials only to people that we know are part of the community and want to contribute in building/improving/fixing b.org
